Video Games: A New Form of Art?

Written by: Lynn Nguyen

Original link

Outline

Keywords: video games, art, digital art, debate, technology, mediums, entertainment, graphic design, interactive experience, game aesthetics

Discipline List: Arts and Humanities: Art and Design: Interactive Arts; Fiction; Nonfiction; Communication Technology and New Media; Critical and Cultural Studies; Advertising

      1. Introduction: Nowadays, video games are a great part of our culture. Just like any other visual expression, video game art can provoke emotions, make us think and surprise us with new ideas or just make us smile. Despite the fact that video games have been in the art world since the beginning of their creation and many of their creators are artists who made great works on the basis of this medium, video game art is still struggling to be recognized as a great potential art form. 

      2. Body:

    • In the early days, video games were played on large arcade machines and home consoles with 2D graphics and simple sounds. Over time, technology has enabled greater detail in-game environments, characters, and their interactions with each other. Video games also have begun to shift in purpose and use. Besides entertainment, video games nowadays focus on artistic elements such as narrative, music, and graphic design.
    • Video games can be considered a branch of Digital Art. It is a subject that investigates connections between video games and art, such as theory and aesthetics. Video games include many different types of art forms such as drawing, sculpting, 3D modeling, illustration, animation, dynamic music, etc. Moreover, artists use these new tools to express ideas, tell stories and create their own art within popular games.
    • Examples of some video game art and their artistic value:
    • A good example of an art game is Another world (1991). Another World is a cinematic platformer game published in 1991 by Delphine Software and is the brainchild of French graphic designer and programmer Eric Chahi. In this game, the main character jumps and runs from platform to platform to avoid obstacles and keep moving forward. With its groundbreaking use of advanced effects in sound and editing as well as graphics, the game has been acclaimed for its unique atmosphere and minimalist aesthetic.
    • Another example is The Path, released in 2009 by the independent game company Tale of Tales. This game uses gothic horror to retell a classic fairy tale about growing up. The Path also goes against traditional video game mechanics as it regularly takes control of the character from the player, giving it a voyeuristic pace of play. The ethereal artistic design and attention to detail add to the mood, creating a beautiful setting.
    • Against argument:  There are many arguments against the gaming industry as an art form. According to Roger Ebert and others, video games cannot be art because they lack the taste and culture required for art. They think video games are a great source of entertainment but don't consider video games as art. Video games are more about interaction with other characters in the game rather than creating something unique as it happens through painting or photography.
    • Supporting 1: As the debate around whether or not video games can be considered "high art" continues to rage, there are signs that video games are potentially modern art:
    • Video games combine visual art with interactive experiences
    • Video games can be, and frequently are, just as thought-provoking, moving, and sophisticated as any other form of art.
    • Video games also offer a rich tapestry of experiences and emotions that rival those of other media.
    • Supporting 2: Video games are officially art. The Museum of Modern Art has officially added video games to its collection. "The Museum of Modern Art bought 14 video games last week to add to its permanent collection—making video games not just interesting anthropological artifacts but also a form of art."

      3. Conclusion: I believe that video games are, indeed, a form of art. The evolution of video games has created a new media that combines visual art with interactive experiences. Video games have clearly become ingrainedengrained in modern culture, and with the technological advances made are well on their way to being considered modern art.
